availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Frank Madden (Louisville book store owner and Civil War quartermaster, 15th KY Reg.)

body.p: Residence: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky. A book store owner. Born in Brooklyn, New York. Came to Louisville at age 12 (c1838). A volunteer fireman in early Louisville. Married Anne McKenzie in 1846. At start of Civil War enlisted in the 15th Kentucky Regiment (Union Army). Served as quartermaster.

bibl.p: "Pioneer Resident of Jefferson County Dies," Louisville Courier-Journal, 5 Dec 1910, 3. ProQuest Historical Newspapers.
